metadata.title: CVE-2019-20372 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
NGINX before 1.17.7, with certain error_page configurations, allows HTTPrequest smuggling, as demonstrated by the ability of an attacker to readunauthorized web pages in environments where NGINX is being fronted by aload balancer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20372` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nginx - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
nginx-common - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
nginx-core - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
nginx-extras - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
nginx-full - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
nginx-light - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nginx package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5').
